trial_identification.studytitle: Recovery of hand function following stroke
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Theta Burst Stimulation to promote balanced brain activity following stroke

interventions.interventions: Magnetic brain stimulation applied for up to two minutes, once per week, for up to 5 weeks.

primaryOutcome.timepoint: Immediately following, and up to 40 minutes after intervention.
Immediately following, and up to 40 minutes after intervention.

secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Immediately following, and up to 40 minutes after intervention.

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: First-ever monohemispheric subcortical stroke at least 3 months prior to enrolment; Upper limb weakness.
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: Contraindications to transcranial magnetic stimulation and/or magnetic resonance imaging; Unable to walk unassisted; Unable to give informed consent.

trial_design.concealment: The order of stimulation protocols for each participant is randomly determined using custom software by a researcher who is blinded to data collection and analysis. The researcher responsible for data collection and analysis is blinded to the order of stimulation protocols allocated to each participant.
trial_design.sequence: The random allocation of stimulation protocols is generated by computerized random number generation.
trial_design.designfeatures: All participants receive one â¿¿placeboâ¿¿ session, where sham stimulation is delivered. These sessions serve as control sessions for the other stimulation protocols.
